channel.title: Research on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Research on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: AI Is Eliminating Jobs for Younger Workers
item.description: New research from Stanford provides the clearest available evidence that AI is reshaping the workforce—but it’s complicated.

item.title: AI Is Eliminating Jobs for Younger Workers
item.description: New research from Stanford provides the clearest available evidence that AI is reshaping the workforce—but it’s complicated.

item.title: The Mysterious Origins of the Most Energetic Neutrino Ever Detected
item.description: Two years ago, Earth was hit by the most energetic neutrino in history. Scientists thought it might be a measurement error, but a new study has confirmed this “ghost particle” was real.

item.title: The Mysterious Origins of the Most Energetic Neutrino Ever Detected
item.description: Two years ago, Earth was hit by the most energetic neutrino in history. Scientists thought it might be a measurement error, but a new study has confirmed this “ghost particle” was real.

item.title: An Ancient Penis Worm With Rings of Sharp Teeth Has Been Discovered in the Grand Canyon
item.description: The 500-million-year-old fossil, containing a species named in honor of the krayt dragons in Star Wars, is a much larger ancestor of phallic marine worms that can be found on the seabed today.

item.title: An Ancient Penis Worm With Rings of Sharp Teeth Has Been Discovered in the Grand Canyon
item.description: The 500-million-year-old fossil, containing a species named in honor of the krayt dragons in Star Wars, is a much larger ancestor of phallic marine worms that can be found on the seabed today.

item.title: RFK Jr. Is Supporting mRNA Research—Just Not for Vaccines
item.description: HHS is slashing hundreds of millions in funding for mRNA vaccines and infectious disease treatments, but leaving the door open to mRNA therapies for cancer and genetic conditions.

item.title: RFK Jr. Is Supporting mRNA Research—Just Not for Vaccines
item.description: HHS is slashing hundreds of millions in funding for mRNA vaccines and infectious disease treatments, but leaving the door open to mRNA therapies for cancer and genetic conditions.

item.title: Central American Beaches Are Being Overrun With Local and Foreign Plastic
item.description: A study of plastic bottles washed up on the Pacific coast of Latin America has identified a double problem—a mass of local waste combined with long-traveling bottles from Asia.

item.title: Central American Beaches Are Being Overrun With Local and Foreign Plastic
item.description: A study of plastic bottles washed up on the Pacific coast of Latin America has identified a double problem—a mass of local waste combined with long-traveling bottles from Asia.

item.title: The Black Market for Fake Science Is Growing Faster Than Legitimate Research, Study Warns
item.description: A small but growing number of academics are improperly taking credit for articles, citations, and authorships, allowing them to appear prestigious without having conducted their own research.

item.title: The Black Market for Fake Science Is Growing Faster Than Legitimate Research, Study Warns
item.description: A small but growing number of academics are improperly taking credit for articles, citations, and authorships, allowing them to appear prestigious without having conducted their own research.

item.title: Inside Jeffrey Epstein’s Forgotten AI Summit
item.description: Long before ChatGPT, a group of AI luminaries gathered on an island to discuss the future of artificial intelligence. Their funder ultimately cast a shadow on all who attended.

item.title: Inside Jeffrey Epstein’s Forgotten AI Summit

item.title: What Your Nighttime Breathing Says About Your Health
item.description: Once dismissed as just snoring, sleep apnea is now emerging as an early warning sign for serious conditions like Alzheimer’s, heart disease, and depression.

item.title: What Your Nighttime Breathing Says About Your Health
item.description: Once dismissed as just snoring, sleep apnea is now emerging as an early warning sign for serious conditions like Alzheimer’s, heart disease, and depression.

item.title: The Hyperflexible People Who May Help Unlock Better Sleep Apnea Treatments
item.description: Patients with Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome are six times more at risk for the sleeping disorder. Now scientists are studying them in hopes of finding remedies beyond the CPAP machine.

item.title: The Hyperflexible People Who May Help Unlock Better Sleep Apnea Treatments
item.description: Patients with Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome are six times more at risk for the sleeping disorder. Now scientists are studying them in hopes of finding remedies beyond the CPAP machine.

item.title: EPA Employees Still in the Dark as Agency Dismantles Scientific Research Office
item.description: As the EPA moves to shut down the Office of Research and Development, leadership is unable to answer questions as basic as when it will close and how many will lose their jobs.
